input: Leave me, and do the thing I bid thee do.
response: Hast thou no letters to me from the friar?

input: Hast thou no letters to me from the friar?
response: No matter: get thee gone,

input: No matter: get thee gone,
response: And hire those horses; I'll be with thee straight.

input: And hire those horses; I'll be with thee straight.
response: Exit BALTHASAR

input: Exit BALTHASAR
response: Well, Juliet, I will lie with thee to-night.

input: Well, Juliet, I will lie with thee to-night.
response: Let's see for means: O mischief, thou art swift

input: Let's see for means: O mischief, thou art swift
response: To enter in the thoughts of desperate men!

input: To enter in the thoughts of desperate men!
response: I do remember an apothecary,--

input: I do remember an apothecary,--
response: And hereabouts he dwells,--which late I noted

input: And hereabouts he dwells,--which late I noted
response: In tatter'd weeds, with overwhelming brows,

input: In tatter'd weeds, with overwhelming brows,
response: Culling of simples; meagre were his looks,

input: Culling of simples; meagre were his looks,
response: Sharp misery had worn him to the bones:

input: Sharp misery had worn him to the bones:
response: And in his needy shop a tortoise hung,

input: And in his needy shop a tortoise hung,
response: An alligator stuff'd, and other skins

input: An alligator stuff'd, and other skins
response: Of ill-shaped fishes; and about his shelves

input: Of ill-shaped fishes; and about his shelves
response: A beggarly account of empty boxes,

input: A beggarly account of empty boxes,
response: Green earthen pots, bladders and musty seeds,

input: Green earthen pots, bladders and musty seeds,
response: Remnants of packthread and old cakes of roses,

input: Remnants of packthread and old cakes of roses,
response: Were thinly scatter'd, to make up a show.

input: Were thinly scatter'd, to make up a show.
response: Noting this penury, to myself I said

input: Noting this penury, to myself I said
response: 'An if a man did need a poison now,

input: 'An if a man did need a poison now,
response: Whose sale is present death in Mantua,

input: Whose sale is present death in Mantua,
response: Here lives a caitiff wretch would sell it him.'

input: Here lives a caitiff wretch would sell it him.'
response: O, this same thought did but forerun my need;

input: O, this same thought did but forerun my need;
response: And this same needy man must sell it me.

input: And this same needy man must sell it me.
response: As I remember, this should be the house.

input: As I remember, this should be the house.
response: Being holiday, the beggar's shop is shut.

input: Being holiday, the beggar's shop is shut.
response: What, ho! apothecary!

input: What, ho! apothecary!
response: Enter Apothecary

input: Enter Apothecary
response: Apothecary

input: Apothecary
response: Who calls so loud?

input: Who calls so loud?
response: Come hither, man. I see that thou art poor:

input: Come hither, man. I see that thou art poor:
response: Hold, there is forty ducats: let me have

input: Hold, there is forty ducats: let me have
response: A dram of poison, such soon-speeding gear

input: A dram of poison, such soon-speeding gear
response: As will disperse itself through all the veins

input: As will disperse itself through all the veins
response: That the life-weary taker may fall dead

input: That the life-weary taker may fall dead
response: And that the trunk may be discharged of breath

input: And that the trunk may be discharged of breath
response: As violently as hasty powder fired

input: As violently as hasty powder fired
response: Doth hurry from the fatal cannon's womb.

input: Doth hurry from the fatal cannon's womb.
response: Apothecary

input: Apothecary
response: Such mortal drugs I have; but Mantua's law

input: Such mortal drugs I have; but Mantua's law
response: Is death to any he that utters them.

input: Is death to any he that utters them.
response: Art thou so bare and full of wretchedness,

input: Art thou so bare and full of wretchedness,
response: And fear'st to die? famine is in thy cheeks,

input: And fear'st to die? famine is in thy cheeks,
response: Need and oppression starveth in thine eyes,

input: Need and oppression starveth in thine eyes,
response: Contempt and beggary hangs upon thy back;

input: Contempt and beggary hangs upon thy back;
response: The world is not thy friend nor the world's law;

input: The world is not thy friend nor the world's law;
response: The world affords no law to make thee rich;

input: The world affords no law to make thee rich;
response: Then be not poor, but break it, and take this.

input: Then be not poor, but break it, and take this.
response: Apothecary

input: Apothecary
response: My poverty, but not my will, consents.

input: My poverty, but not my will, consents.
response: I pay thy poverty, and not thy will.

input: I pay thy poverty, and not thy will.
response: Apothecary

input: Apothecary
response: Put this in any liquid thing you will,

input: Put this in any liquid thing you will,
response: And drink it off; and, if you had the strength

input: And drink it off; and, if you had the strength
response: Of twenty men, it would dispatch you straight.

input: Of twenty men, it would dispatch you straight.
response: There is thy gold, worse poison to men's souls,

input: There is thy gold, worse poison to men's souls,
response: Doing more murders in this loathsome world,

input: Doing more murders in this loathsome world,
response: Than these poor compounds that thou mayst not sell.

input: Than these poor compounds that thou mayst not sell.
response: I sell thee poison; thou hast sold me none.

input: I sell thee poison; thou hast sold me none.
response: Farewell: buy food, and get thyself in flesh.

input: Farewell: buy food, and get thyself in flesh.
response: Come, cordial and not poison, go with me

input: Come, cordial and not poison, go with me
response: To Juliet's grave; for there must I use thee.

input: To Juliet's grave; for there must I use thee.
response: Exeunt

input: Exeunt
response: SCENE II. Friar Laurence's cell.

input: SCENE II. Friar Laurence's cell.
response: Enter FRIAR JOHN

input: Enter FRIAR JOHN
response: Give me that mattock and the wrenching iron.

input: Give me that mattock and the wrenching iron.
response: Hold, take this letter; early in the morning

input: Hold, take this letter; early in the morning
response: See thou deliver it to my lord and father.

input: See thou deliver it to my lord and father.
response: Give me the light: upon thy life, I charge thee,

input: Give me the light: upon thy life, I charge thee,
response: Whate'er thou hear'st or seest, stand all aloof,

input: Whate'er thou hear'st or seest, stand all aloof,
response: And do not interrupt me in my course.

input: And do not interrupt me in my course.
response: Why I descend into this bed of death,

input: Why I descend into this bed of death,
response: Is partly to behold my lady's face;

input: Is partly to behold my lady's face;
response: But chiefly to take thence from her dead finger

input: But chiefly to take thence from her dead finger
response: A precious ring, a ring that I must use

input: A precious ring, a ring that I must use
response: In dear employment: therefore hence, be gone:

input: In dear employment: therefore hence, be gone:
response: But if thou, jealous, dost return to pry

input: But if thou, jealous, dost return to pry
response: In what I further shall intend to do,

input: In what I further shall intend to do,
response: By heaven, I will tear thee joint by joint

input: By heaven, I will tear thee joint by joint
response: And strew this hungry churchyard with thy limbs:

input: And strew this hungry churchyard with thy limbs:
response: The time and my intents are savage-wild,

input: The time and my intents are savage-wild,
response: More fierce and more inexorable far

input: More fierce and more inexorable far
response: Than empty tigers or the roaring sea.

input: Than empty tigers or the roaring sea.
response: So shalt thou show me friendship. Take thou that:

input: So shalt thou show me friendship. Take thou that:
response: Live, and be prosperous: and farewell, good fellow.

input: Live, and be prosperous: and farewell, good fellow.
response: Thou detestable maw, thou womb of death,

input: Thou detestable maw, thou womb of death,
response: Gorged with the dearest morsel of the earth,

input: Gorged with the dearest morsel of the earth,
response: Thus I enforce thy rotten jaws to open,

input: Thus I enforce thy rotten jaws to open,
response: And, in despite, I'll cram thee with more food!

input: And, in despite, I'll cram thee with more food!
response: Opens the tomb

input: Opens the tomb
response: I must indeed; and therefore came I hither.

input: I must indeed; and therefore came I hither.
response: Good gentle youth, tempt not a desperate man;

input: Good gentle youth, tempt not a desperate man;
response: Fly hence, and leave me: think upon these gone;

input: Fly hence, and leave me: think upon these gone;
response: Let them affright thee. I beseech thee, youth,

input: Let them affright thee. I beseech thee, youth,
response: Put not another sin upon my head,

input: Put not another sin upon my head,
response: By urging me to fury: O, be gone!

input: By urging me to fury: O, be gone!
response: By heaven, I love thee better than myself;

input: By heaven, I love thee better than myself;
response: For I come hither arm'd against myself:

input: For I come hither arm'd against myself:
response: Stay not, be gone; live, and hereafter say,

input: Stay not, be gone; live, and hereafter say,
response: A madman's mercy bade thee run away.

input: A madman's mercy bade thee run away.
response: Wilt thou provoke me? then have at thee, boy!

input: Wilt thou provoke me? then have at thee, boy!
response: They fight

input: They fight
response: In faith, I will. Let me peruse this face.

input: In faith, I will. Let me peruse this face.
response: Mercutio's kinsman, noble County Paris!

input: Mercutio's kinsman, noble County Paris!
response: What said my man, when my betossed soul

input: What said my man, when my betossed soul
response: Did not attend him as we rode? I think

input: Did not attend him as we rode? I think
response: He told me Paris should have married Juliet:

input: He told me Paris should have married Juliet:
response: Said he not so? or did I dream it so?

input: Said he not so? or did I dream it so?
response: Or am I mad, hearing him talk of Juliet,

input: Or am I mad, hearing him talk of Juliet,
response: To think it was so? O, give me thy hand,

input: To think it was so? O, give me thy hand,
response: One writ with me in sour misfortune's book!

input: One writ with me in sour misfortune's book!
response: I'll bury thee in a triumphant grave;

input: I'll bury thee in a triumphant grave;
response: A grave? O no! a lantern, slaughter'd youth,

input: A grave? O no! a lantern, slaughter'd youth,
response: For here lies Juliet, and her beauty makes

input: For here lies Juliet, and her beauty makes
response: This vault a feasting presence full of light.

input: This vault a feasting presence full of light.
response: Death, lie thou there, by a dead man interr'd.

input: Death, lie thou there, by a dead man interr'd.
response: Laying PARIS in the tomb

input: Laying PARIS in the tomb
response: How oft when men are at the point of death

input: How oft when men are at the point of death
response: Have they been merry! which their keepers call

input: Have they been merry! which their keepers call
response: A lightning before death: O, how may I

input: A lightning before death: O, how may I
response: Call this a lightning? O my love! my wife!

input: Call this a lightning? O my love! my wife!
response: Death, that hath suck'd the honey of thy breath,

input: Death, that hath suck'd the honey of thy breath,
response: Hath had no power yet upon thy beauty:

input: Hath had no power yet upon thy beauty:
response: Thou art not conquer'd; beauty's ensign yet

input: Thou art not conquer'd; beauty's ensign yet
response: Is crimson in thy lips and in thy cheeks,

input: Is crimson in thy lips and in thy cheeks,
response: And death's pale flag is not advanced there.

input: And death's pale flag is not advanced there.
response: Tybalt, liest thou there in thy bloody sheet?

input: Tybalt, liest thou there in thy bloody sheet?
response: O, what more favour can I do to thee,

input: O, what more favour can I do to thee,
response: Than with that hand that cut thy youth in twain

input: Than with that hand that cut thy youth in twain
response: To sunder his that was thine enemy?

input: To sunder his that was thine enemy?
response: Forgive me, cousin! Ah, dear Juliet,

input: Forgive me, cousin! Ah, dear Juliet,
response: Why art thou yet so fair? shall I believe

input: Why art thou yet so fair? shall I believe
response: That unsubstantial death is amorous,

input: That unsubstantial death is amorous,
response: And that the lean abhorred monster keeps

input: And that the lean abhorred monster keeps
response: Thee here in dark to be his paramour?

input: Thee here in dark to be his paramour?
response: For fear of that, I still will stay with thee;

input: For fear of that, I still will stay with thee;
response: And never from this palace of dim night

input: And never from this palace of dim night
response: Depart again: here, here will I remain

input: Depart again: here, here will I remain
response: With worms that are thy chamber-maids; O, here

input: With worms that are thy chamber-maids; O, here
response: Will I set up my everlasting rest,

input: Will I set up my everlasting rest,
response: And shake the yoke of inauspicious stars

input: And shake the yoke of inauspicious stars
response: From this world-wearied flesh. Eyes, look your last!

input: From this world-wearied flesh. Eyes, look your last!
response: Arms, take your last embrace! and, lips, O you

input: Arms, take your last embrace! and, lips, O you
response: The doors of breath, seal with a righteous kiss

input: The doors of breath, seal with a righteous kiss
response: A dateless bargain to engrossing death!

input: A dateless bargain to engrossing death!
response: Come, bitter conduct, come, unsavoury guide!

input: Come, bitter conduct, come, unsavoury guide!
response: Thou desperate pilot, now at once run on

input: Thou desperate pilot, now at once run on
response: The dashing rocks thy sea-sick weary bark!

response: Here's to my love!

input: Here's to my love!
response: Drinks

input: Drinks
response: O true apothecary!

input: O true apothecary!
